casebody.data:
Kenneth Lee CROW, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. McELROY COAL COMPANY, a division of Consol Energy Incorporated, Defendant-Appellee. No. 03-1913. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted Sept. 30, 2003. Decided Oct. 7, 2003. Kenneth Lee Crow, pro se. *650Before WILKINSON, NIEMEYER, and MICHAEL, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

PER CURIAM.

Kenneth Lee Crow appeals the district court’s order accepting the recommendation of the magistrate judge to dismiss Crow’s employment discrimination complaint pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1915(e)(2)(B) (2000). We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. See Crow v. McElroy Coal Co., No. CA-02-52-5 (N.D.W. Va. June 24, 2003). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
